description: From boat +â€Ž load. Notionally, because the commodity in question might have constituted the entire load of a cargo ship or boat.

entries.meaning: Cargo or passengers that fill a boat.

examples: He showed up an hour later with a whole boatload of hamburgers, chips, cookies, and assorted other munchies, not to mention sodas and beer, and we all fell in and stuffed ourselves silly.
